page.title: 16Farming - Cropping
page.content: There are 10 farms in the area, varying from 100 to 1000 acres, all within ring fences. All are livestock rearing, with varying amounts of cropping. The arable area would be larger were it not for heavy slow draining clay, particularly on lower lying areas (hence brickworks). Land is almost all tile drained, with as much as 25% completed within the preceding 20 yrs (agricultural grants and postwar agricultural boom). This has allowed some expansion of arable area and intensification of stocking rates. Barley is the main crop grown largely for home use but wheat has increased in importance and oats are still grown on 2 farms. The once universal swede has now disappeared from half the farms as silage making has spread and only 2 farms still rely on hay.
